questions.question: What is a computer system?
options: A collection of only hardware components
A combination of people, hardware, software, data, and procedures
A machine used only for calculations
questions.explanation: A computer system consists of people, hardware, software, data, and procedures working together.

questions.question: Which component of a computer system is considered the most important?
questions.explanation: People are the most important because they operate the system and use the output.

questions.question: Which of the following refers to the physical parts of a computer?
questions.explanation: Hardware consists of the physical devices of a computer.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of computer hardware?
questions.explanation: Keyboard is a physical input device.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of software?
questions.explanation: Software instructs the computer and converts raw data into useful information.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines software?
options: A set of instructions the computer follows
questions.explanation: Software is a set of logical instructions used to perform tasks.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of a computer system?
questions.explanation: Electricity is required but not classified as a system component.

questions.question: Data can best be described as:
questions.explanation: Data consists of raw facts before processing.

questions.question: Information is produced when data is:
questions.explanation: Processing data gives it meaning, producing information.

questions.question: Which of the following best distinguishes data from information?
options: Data is meaningful, information is not
Data is processed, information is raw
Data is raw facts, information has meaning
questions.explanation: Information is processed data that has context and meaning.

questions.question: Which operation is NOT a basic operation of a computer?
questions.explanation: Manufacturing is not a computer operation.

questions.question: Computer components can be grouped into how many main categories?
questions.explanation: They are grouped into hardware and software.

questions.question: Which category includes operating systems?
questions.explanation: Operating systems are part of system software.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of application software?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Word is used by users to perform tasks.

questions.question: System software primarily helps the computer to:
questions.explanation: System software manages hardware and system resources.

questions.question: Which type of software controls the overall operation of a computer?
questions.explanation: System software manages hardware and controls computer operations.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an operating system?
questions.explanation: Windows is an operating system.

questions.question: What is the primary function of an operating system?
options: Manage computer hardware and software resources
questions.explanation: The operating system manages resources and provides services to applications.

questions.question: Which software helps maintain, protect, and optimize a computer system?
questions.explanation: Utility software performs maintenance and optimization tasks.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of utility software?
questions.explanation: Antivirus software is a utility program.

questions.question: What happens during the booting process?
options: The operating system is loaded into memory
questions.explanation: Booting loads the operating system into memory.

questions.question: Which firmware starts the booting process?
questions.explanation: BIOS initializes hardware and starts the boot process.

questions.question: What does POST stand for?
questions.explanation: POST stands for Power On Self Test.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of POST?
questions.explanation: POST checks hardware components before booting.

questions.question: Which component stores BIOS permanently?
questions.explanation: BIOS is stored in ROM.

questions.question: Which memory type is non-volatile?
questions.explanation: ROM does not lose data when power is off.

questions.question: Which memory is closest to the CPU?
questions.explanation: Cache memory is located closest to the CPU.

questions.question: Why is cache memory faster than RAM?
options: It is closer to the CPU
questions.explanation: Cache is faster because it is closer to the CPU.

questions.question: Which unit performs arithmetic and logical operations?
questions.explanation: ALU performs arithmetic and logical operations.

questions.question: Which part of the CPU controls and coordinates all activities?
questions.explanation: The Control Unit directs all CPU operations.

questions.question: What is primary storage?
options: Storage directly accessible by the CPU
questions.explanation: Primary storage is directly accessed by the CPU.

questions.question: Which of the following is secondary storage?
questions.explanation: Hard disks are secondary storage devices.

questions.question: Which storage device uses magnetic disks?
questions.explanation: HDDs use magnetic disks.

questions.question: Which storage device is fastest?
questions.explanation: SSDs are faster due to lack of moving parts.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of SSDs over HDDs?
questions.explanation: SSDs provide faster access speeds.

questions.question: What is a database?
options: An organized collection of related data
questions.explanation: A database stores related data in an organized manner.

questions.question: What does DBMS stand for?
questions.explanation: DBMS stands for Database Management System.

questions.question: What is the main function of a DBMS?
questions.explanation: DBMS manages and organizes data efficiently.

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of using a DBMS?
questions.explanation: DBMS improves data security and control.

questions.question: Which database model organizes data in tables?
questions.explanation: Relational databases store data in tables.

questions.question: What is a table in a database?
options: A collection of rows and columns
questions.explanation: Tables consist of rows and columns.

questions.question: What is a record in a database table?
questions.explanation: A record corresponds to a row in a table.

questions.question: What is a field in a database table?
questions.explanation: A field is a column in a table.

questions.question: Which key uniquely identifies a record in a table?
questions.explanation: A primary key uniquely identifies records.

questions.question: What is a foreign key?
options: A key used to encrypt data
A key that links two tables
A unique identifier in one table
questions.explanation: Foreign keys link tables together.

questions.question: Which database model represents data as a tree?
questions.explanation: Hierarchical databases use a tree structure.

questions.question: Which database model allows many-to-many relationships?
questions.explanation: Network models support many-to-many relationships.

questions.question: Which database model uses objects and classes?
questions.explanation: Object-oriented databases use objects and classes.

questions.question: What is data redundancy?
options: Repeated storage of the same data
questions.explanation: Data redundancy means storing duplicate data.

questions.question: Which problem is reduced by using a DBMS?
questions.explanation: DBMS reduces data redundancy.

questions.question: What is data integrity?
questions.explanation: Data integrity ensures accuracy and consistency.

questions.question: Which feature of DBMS controls who can access data?
questions.explanation: DBMS provides data security mechanisms.

questions.question: What is data independence?
options: Ability to change data without affecting programs
questions.explanation: Data independence allows data changes without program changes.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes information?
questions.explanation: Information is processed data with meaning.

questions.question: Why are databases important in computer systems?
options: They organize and manage large amounts of data
questions.explanation: Databases efficiently organize and manage data.

questions.question: What is primary memory?
options: Memory directly accessed by the CPU
questions.explanation: Primary memory is directly accessible by the CPU.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of primary memory?
questions.explanation: RAM is a primary memory device.

questions.question: Which memory loses its content when power is turned off?
questions.explanation: RAM is volatile memory.

questions.question: ROM is best described as?
questions.explanation: ROM stores permanent instructions.

questions.question: Which memory is faster?
questions.explanation: Cache memory is the fastest memory.

questions.question: What is secondary storage mainly used for?
questions.explanation: Secondary storage stores data permanently.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a secondary storage device?
questions.explanation: RAM is primary memory.

questions.question: What does CPU stand for?
questions.explanation: CPU stands for Central Processing Unit.

questions.question: Which part of the CPU performs calculations?
questions.explanation: ALU performs arithmetic and logical operations.

questions.question: What is the function of the Control Unit?
questions.explanation: The Control Unit manages and coordinates operations.

questions.question: Which device is used to input text into a computer?
questions.explanation: Keyboard is used for text input.

questions.question: Which device displays visual output?
questions.explanation: Monitor displays visual output.

questions.question: A printer is an example of a?
questions.explanation: Printers produce output on paper.

questions.question: Which input device is used to capture images?
questions.explanation: Scanners capture images.

questions.question: What is software?
questions.explanation: Software consists of programs and instructions.

questions.question: Which of the following is system software?
questions.explanation: Operating systems are system software.

questions.question: Which software manages computer hardware?
questions.explanation: System software controls hardware resources.

questions.question: What is application software used for?
questions.explanation: Application software performs user tasks.

questions.question: Which is an example of application software?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Word is application software.

questions.question: What does an operating system do?
questions.explanation: An OS manages hardware and software resources.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an operating system?
questions.explanation: Excel is application software.

questions.question: What is booting?
questions.explanation: Booting is the process of starting a computer.

questions.question: Which type of computer is portable?
questions.explanation: Laptops are portable computers.

questions.question: Which computer is most powerful?
questions.explanation: Supercomputers are the most powerful.

questions.question: Mainframe computers are mainly used for?
questions.explanation: Mainframes handle large volumes of data.

questions.question: What is data?
questions.explanation: Data are raw facts.

questions.question: What is information?
questions.explanation: Information is processed data.

questions.question: Which of the following converts data into information?
questions.explanation: Processing converts data into information.

questions.question: Which stage shows results to the user?
questions.explanation: Output displays processed results.

questions.question: Which stage saves data for future use?
questions.explanation: Storage saves data and information.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines computer science?
questions.explanation: Computer science studies computation and information.

questions.question: Which field focuses on creating programs?
questions.explanation: Programming focuses on writing software.

questions.question: Which field deals with data storage and retrieval?
questions.explanation: Databases manage stored data.

questions.question: Which field focuses on communication between computers?
questions.explanation: Networking handles computer communication.

questions.question: What is a computer system?
questions.explanation: A system combines hardware and software.

questions.question: Which component is tangible?
questions.explanation: Hardware is physical.

questions.question: Which component is intangible?
questions.explanation: Software is intangible.

questions.question: What ensures proper use of a computer system?
questions.explanation: Users operate computer systems.

questions.question: Which of the following is a limitation of computers?
questions.explanation: Computers cannot think on their own.

questions.question: Which characteristic means computers do not get tired?
questions.explanation: Diligence means consistent performance.

questions.question: Which characteristic allows computers to work automatically?
questions.explanation: Automation enables self-operation after instruction.

questions.question: Which characteristic refers to performing different tasks?
questions.explanation: Versatility means multi-purpose use.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a computer characteristic?
questions.explanation: Computers lack intelligence.

questions.question: Which unit measures processing speed?
questions.explanation: Hertz measures CPU speed.

questions.question: Which factor affects computer performance?
questions.explanation: CPU speed impacts performance.

questions.question: Which memory improves processing speed?
questions.explanation: Cache improves processing speed.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about computers?
questions.explanation: Computers only follow instructions.

questions.question: Which component executes program instructions?
questions.explanation: CPU executes instructions.

questions.question: Which of the following best summarizes a computer?
options: An electronic device that processes data
questions.explanation: Computers process data into information.

questions.question: Why is computer science important?
questions.explanation: Computer science helps solve problems using computation.
